ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: gained a much more solid background in the *technical* basics of light microscopy. also more knowledge of various approaches and applications.
I learned more about the theory behind different microscopy techniques and how to apply that to my own research. As a novice in microscopy, it was very helpful.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: with a slightly expanded curriculum, this course could easy count as 1.0 credits, rather than just 0.5.
The course would be much better off as a full credit course given the weekly time commitment. I also think that more hands-on modules would help with the overall goal of the class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: simply put, if you are interesting in learning more about light microscopy, this course is a must-take.
I would recommend this course to anyone interested in microscopy that has little background in it.
